title: 100+ Tuesday Motivation Quotes & Messages for Work

steps.title: Quotes from inspiring figures can boost your mood and productivity.
steps.content: Quotes from inspiring figures can boost your mood and productivity. Whether you want to maintain a productive beginning to your Tuesday or jump-start a sluggish one, an uplifting quote from a famous leader, author, or athlete can do the trick. Reading their motivating words can raise your spirits and give you the energy to achieve your goals . [1] X Research source "The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing." —Walt Disney "Believe you can and you're halfway there." —Theodore Roosevelt "Great things come from hard work and perseverance. No Excuses." —Kobe Bryant “Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny." —C.S. Lewis "Find a group of people who challenge and inspire you, spend a lot of time with them, and it will change your life forever." —Amy Poehler "It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop." —Confucius "The only impossible journey is the one you never begin." —Tony Robbins "Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'" —Audrey Hepburn "I am lucky that whatever fear I have inside me, my desire to win is always stronger." —Serena Williams "Don’t count the days, make the days count." —Muhammad Ali "Great things are done by a series of small things brought together." —Vincent van Gogh "Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you." —Mary Lou Retton "It always seems impossible until it's done." —Nelson Mandela “One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Two, never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it. Three, if you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don’t throw it away.” —Stephen Hawking “Either you run the day or the day runs you.” —Jim Rohn “I’m a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.” —Thomas Jefferson “Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.” —Tony Robbins “You’ve got to get up every morning with determination if you’re going to go to bed with satisfaction.” —George Lorimer “Just one small positive thought in the morning can change your whole day.” —Dalai Lama “Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.” —Albert Einstein

steps.title: Inspiring quotes about success can boost your confidence.
steps.content: Inspiring quotes about success can boost your confidence. If you had a difficult Monday at work, starting off Tuesday strong can feel like a challenge. Reading these quotes from influential figures about achieving success can help you believe in yourself , boost your positivity, and feel recharged to tackle the day ahead. [2] X Research source "Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined." — Henry David Thoreau "Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another stepping stone to greatness." —Oprah Winfrey "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts." —Winston Churchill "You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated." —Maya Angelou "Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game." —Babe Ruth "Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up." —Thomas Edison "Success isn't always about greatness. It's about consistency. Consistent hard work leads to success. Greatness will come." —Dwayne Johnson "Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes but they don't quit." —Conrad Hilton "I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the water to create many ripples." —Mother Teresa "If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success." —James Cameron "The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity." —Amelia Earhart "If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time." —Steve Jobs "To bring about change, you must not be afraid to take the first step. We will fail when we fail to try." —Rosa Parks "Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong." —Ella Fitzgerald "Don't sit down and wait for the opportunities to come. Get up and make them." —Madam C.J. Walker "You must expect great things from yourself before you can do them." —Michael Jordan “I never dreamed about success. I worked for it.” —Estee Lauder “Don’t settle for average. Bring your best to the moment. Then, whether it fails or succeeds, at least you know you gave all you had.” —Angela Bassett "You miss 100% of the shots you don't take." —Wayne Gretzky “I’d rather regret the things I’ve done than regret the things I haven’t done.” —Lucille Ball

steps.title: Use these messages to spark your motivation and get through the week.
steps.content: Use these messages to spark your motivation and get through the week. Set a positive tone for the week to help you stay focused , be productive , and hit your targets. These personalized messages can put a smile on your face and pep in your step to finish Tuesday strong. Feel free to share these messages with your colleagues, too, to help motivate your entire team . “Let’s make this Tuesday a great one! It’s a new day with exciting opportunities.” “This is the only Tuesday of this week. Let’s make the most of it.” “Let’s keep the momentum going from Monday. Tuesday is going to be a great day.” “I am greeting Tuesday with positivity and determination. This is the day to get things done!” “Nothing will stop me from achieving my goals this Tuesday.” “Tuesday is the day to turn my goals into achievements.” “I am taking charge of Tuesday. Let’s stay motivated and hit our goals.” “I am excited about tackling this Tuesday! I’m confident that I’m going to check off all my to-dos.” “Bring it on, Tuesday! I’m ready to work hard and make the day great.” “Nothing can distract me this Tuesday. I’m prepared to handle any challenge headed my way.” “Walking into Tuesday with a smile on my face. I’m ready to make this day a productive one!” “This Tuesday, let’s turn challenges into successes!” “I am full of drive and creative ideas today. I’m going to make this Tuesday count!” “I am proud of the work I’m doing and I can’t wait to continue it this Tuesday.” “I’m seeing the results of my hard work from Monday. Let’s keep up the good work today!”

steps.title: Start your Tuesday with an uplifting boost.
steps.content: Start your Tuesday with an uplifting boost. Whether you’re excited to tackle the day or still feeling the Monday blues, beginning your Tuesday with a motivating message can help you focus your energy, feel positive, and set yourself up for success. “Good morning, Tuesday! I’m excited to see where the workday will take me.” “I’m going into this Tuesday morning full of positivity and motivation. Let’s start off the day strong!” “I survived Monday morning, so I can survive Tuesday morning, too. Let’s make it a great day!” “Good morning, Tuesday! It’s a fresh, new day. I’m refreshed and reenergized to achieve my goals.” “It’s Tuesday morning again. I’m prepared to tackle any obstacles in my way.” “I’m feeling productive this Tuesday morning! I’m ready to start my day strong and fulfill all my responsibilities.” “Tuesday morning is the perfect time to focus on my goals and check off my to-do list.” “Good morning, Tuesday! I’m going to hit my stride today and get everything that I need to get done.” “Tuesday morning is full of promise for a great workday. I’m feeling motivated and energized to start the day!” “It’s Tuesday morning, which means I’m 1 day closer to Friday. I’ve got what it takes to make this day a productive one!”

steps.title: A Tuesday blessing can help you start the day with gratitude.
steps.content: A Tuesday blessing can help you start the day with gratitude. If you’re religious or spiritual, a motivational Tuesday blessing is a great way to reflect before you start your day. Remembering that the workday is full of opportunities to learn and grow can help boost your mood, energy, and productivity. Feel free to send these to coworkers who are religious, too. “May this Tuesday be full of energy and productivity.” “I am sending out blessings on this wonderful Tuesday. May opportunities come my way that help me learn and grow.” “May this Tuesday give me the strength to overcome any obstacles that come my way.” “May this be a blessed Tuesday! Let’s embrace the day and take advantage of all the possibilities it holds.” “On this blessed Tuesday, may I find the motivation and energy to get my tasks done.” “Wishing you a blessed Tuesday! May you be filled with positivity and strength to face the day.” “Have a blessed Tuesday! Remember that today is a new day to accomplish tasks and take advantage of every opportunity.” “May this Tuesday be filled with peace, joy, and blessings.” “Wishing you a blessed Tuesday! I hope you are filled with purpose and motivation.” “Let this Tuesday be a reminder to stay positive and productive. The day is full of unimaginable blessings!”

steps.title: Use these messages to step out of your comfort zone and succeed.
steps.content: Use these messages to step out of your comfort zone and succeed. Tuesday can be a tough day, whether you’re dealing with setbacks or procrastinating about a nerve-inducing task. So, keep these messages in mind to help you remember that you’re capable, resilient , and full of potential. “On this Tuesday, remember to believe in yourself. You are capable of getting things done.” “Let’s knock this Tuesday out of the park! You are skilled and strong enough to handle any challenge in your way.” “I believe in my ability to get things done this Tuesday. I am efficient and productive.” “Remember, big rewards come from big risks. This Tuesday is your chance to step out of your comfort zone and achieve your professional goals.” “I am confident and resilient. Even if everything doesn’t go right this Tuesday, I am more than capable of setting things right tomorrow.” “I won’t let fear or procrastination stop me today. I am confident in my abilities and will get my work done.” “On this Tuesday, I’m trusting myself and letting my confidence lead me.” “I am full of potential on this Tuesday. I believe in myself and will overcome any obstacle.” “On this Tuesday, remember that you are always growing and learning. You know more today than you did yesterday!” “I am feeling proud of my accomplishments this Tuesday. I am ready and motivated to achieve even more.”

steps.title: Put a smile on your face with a funny Tuesday message.
steps.content: Put a smile on your face with a funny Tuesday message. We get it, Tuesday isn’t everyone’s favorite day! Taking a moment to poke fun at the Tuesday slump can actually be a great way to lift your spirits and feel more motivated —even if it’s only to get the day over faster! “Hey, at least today isn’t Monday!” “Nothing ruins your Friday like realizing it’s only Tuesday.” “Even my coffee needs a cup of coffee on Tuesdays.” “Dear Tuesday, take a vacation. We could all use a little time away from you.” “Tuesday: A day for doing all the things I forgot on Monday…and pushing them off until Wednesday.” “I’d say ‘Happy Tuesday,’ but we know that’d be a lie.” “My Tuesday morning routine: Hit the snooze button and stay in bed as long as possible.” “Let’s tackle this Tuesday like we tackled Monday: With a lot of coffee.” “Waking up on Monday is brutal…but not as brutal as waking up on Tuesday.” “Tuesday is the new Monday. Which is to say, it’s not Friday.”

steps.title: Greet your colleagues with positivity to make your week better.
steps.content: Greet your colleagues with positivity to make your week better. A “Happy Tuesday” message is a great way to turn you and your colleagues’ day around. Send them one of these messages to uplift their spirits and put a smile on their face so they’re ready to make the work day great. “Happy Tuesday! It’s time to seize the day and make good things happen!” “Happy Tuesday! Let’s learn from yesterday and make today even better!” “Happy Tuesday! Start the day with a smile and let in the positive vibes!” “Have a happy Tuesday! You’re one step closer to achieving your goals for the week!” “Happy Tuesday! Let’s keep up the good work and maintain our Monday motivation!” “It’s going to be a great Tuesday! This is the perfect day to make our dreams a reality!” “Happy Tuesday! It’s a new day full of possibilities and potential.” “Have a great Tuesday! We survived Monday and now we’re that much closer to Friday!” “Happy Tuesday! We can handle anything that comes our way today!” “Have a happy Tuesday! Let’s make it a productive and prosperous one!”

steps.title: Consider making the quote your computer or phone background.
steps.content: Consider making the quote your computer or phone background. Ensure you see your favorite motivational quote everyday by setting it as your phone or work computer background. This is a great way to remind yourself of the message and feel positive and energized for the day.

steps.title: Stick the quote on your desk, office wall, or planner.
steps.content: Stick the quote on your desk, office wall, or planner. Using your favorite quote or message as decoration in your office is another great way to stay motivated at work. Print out the quote or write it on a sticky note and place it somewhere you’ll regularly see it. For instance, keep it on your desk or computer, frame it and hang it on the wall, or attach it to a corkboard or whiteboard.

steps.title: Say the quote as an affirmation.
steps.content: Say the quote as an affirmation. Affirmations are positive statements that you say to yourself that can help challenge negative thoughts or beliefs. So, take a moment during the workday to recite your favorite motivational quote or message. This can help you believe in yourself and your ability to be productive. You might do this at the beginning, middle, or end of the day, or whenever you need a boost.
